results.headline: Brazil’s Tax Change to Shift Soybean Demand to US, Amius Says
results.summary: A surprising tax change in agriculture powerhouse Brazil has the potential to make soy grown in the world’s largest bean exporter less competitive with supplies from the US, according to a report from risk management firm Amius Ltd.

results.authors: By Peter Millard and Mariana Durao
results.headline: Brazil Meat Tycoons Expand in Oil and Gas With Bolivia Deal
results.summary: Brazil’s Batista brothers are expanding the family energy footprint in oil and gas with the acquisition of a company that has three natural-gas fields in the Tarija-Chaco basin in Bolivia.

results.authors: By Rachel Gamarski and Gerson Freitas Jr
results.headline: Suzano Sees Room to Go Heavy on Debt for International Paper
results.summary: Brazilian pulp giant Suzano SA sees room to take on substantial debt as it weighs a new bid for International Paper Co., according to people with direct knowledge of the matter.

results.headline: An India Coalition Hearkens Back to Pre-Modi Politics As Usual But Don't Despair
results.summary: Modi has enough to form a government — with the help of a coalition, just like the bad old days.

results.authors: By Clarice Couto, Gerson Freitas Jr, and Daniel Carvalho
results.headline: Surprise Tax Change Upends Trading in Crop Powerhouse Brazil
results.summary: A surprise tax change in agriculture powerhouse Brazil is disrupting business and drawing the ire of groups representing some of the world’s top crop traders including Cargill Inc. and Bunge Global SA.

results.authors: By Vinicius Andrade, Giovanna Bellotti Azevedo, and Maria Elena Vizcaino
results.headline: Cement Maker Races to Reach CSN Deal as Bonds Teeter on Edge
results.summary: Bonds in InterCement Participacoes SA are implying a roughly one-in-five chance of default in just six weeks time as the cash-strapped Brazilian company races against the clock to reach a takeover deal.

results.authors: By Ignacio Olivera Doll and Manuela Tobias
results.headline: Milei Adviser Expects Major Tech Investments Within Eight Weeks
results.summary: A senior adviser to Argentine President Javier Milei expects the administration to announce significant investments from technology companies within the next eight weeks after visiting Silicon Valley in May.

results.headline: BTG Is Said to Be Close to Announcing New York Bank Acquisition
results.summary: Banco BTG Pactual SA, the biggest independent investment bank in Latin America, is close to announcing the acquisition of a wealth-management bank in New York as part of a global expansion, according to people familiar with the matter.

results.authors: By Colum Murphy and Danny Lee
results.headline: Europe, US Fearful of Chinese Electric Cars, Says BYD Founder
results.summary: Foreign countries are “afraid” of Chinese electric vehicles, BYD Co. Chairman Wang Chuanfu said in a swipe at European and US efforts to constrain imports of China-made cars.

results.headline: Bank of Russia Governor Nabiullina Tells Putin What He Doesn't Want to Hear
results.summary: Bank of Russia Governor Elvira Nabiullina is helping keep Russia’s war economy on the rails but increasingly finds herself out-of-step with the government over key policies.
